result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher D Welsch was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Def is not to consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances without a prescription from licensed physician, with random screenings.

No contact with victims: N. Johnson, Jeff F, Jesse J & Kwik Trip.
.

Pay Crime Lab and Drug Assessment fee (see 'other' above for amount)

  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendent in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

  Pay DOC Supervision fees.

  Undergo any other assessments or evaluations deemed appropriate by PO and follow through with any treatment recommendations.

After care program.
.

Statement as to Negotiated Plea filed - signed/understands.  No promises/threats.  
14CF-291  Count 1 - Possession of Meth. (Fel) 961.41(3g)(g) and 939.50(3)(h)  GUILTY.    Count 2 - Dismissed but read-in
14CF-338  Count 1 - PTC Uttering a Forgery as a Repeater (Fel)  943.38(2) and 939.50(3)(h)  GUILTY.   Counts 2, 3, 4 & 5  Dismissed but read-in
Plea Questionnaire filed - signed/understands.  Rights/elements/questions gone over.  Victim rights act complied with.  No promises/threats.  Mr. Welsch states what he did on those days.
COURT finds the pleas are F, V & I made.  Sufficient factual basis.  Found guilty and convicted.
